summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) personnel discussing travel records for Jeffrey Epstein from October 2016 through 2018. It details numerous private flights between Teterboro, Paris, the US Virgin Islands, and other locations, noting potential missed flights and vehicle entries in the USVI. The correspondence is marked as law enforcement sensitive and includes offers to authenticate records for court.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document is a compilation of his international travel records from 2016-2018, showing frequent private flights between the US (Teterboro, USVI) and Paris, with some travel to St. Barts and Virgin Gorda.

events.title: Outbound flight to Paris
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Teterboro (KTEB) to Le Bourget, Paris (LFPB) via private aircraft.

events.title: Second outbound flight to Paris
events.description: Another outbound flight from Teterboro to Le Bourget, Paris noted as a potential missed flight due to back-to-back reservations.

events.title: Flight to St. Barts
events.description: Outbound flight from Cyril E. King Airport, USVI (TIST) to St. Barts (TFFJ).

events.title: Flights to Virgin Gorda and return
events.description: Outbound flight from USVI to Virgin Gorda (TUPW) and an inbound flight from St. Barts to USVI on the same day.

events.title: Inbound flight from Morocco
events.description: Inbound flight from Marrakesh, Morocco (GMMX) to Long Island Islip (KISP).

events.title: Inbound flight from Canada
events.description: Inbound flight from Goose Bay, Canada (CYYR) to Teterboro.

events.title: Email correspondence on Epstein travel
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel exchange emails analyzing Epstein's travel records and discussing authentication for court purposes.

locations: Cyril E. King Airport, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands (TIST)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein undertook extensive international travel via private aircraft between October 2016 and November 2018, with frequent trips between Teterboro, NJ and Paris, France.
The travel records indicate potential missed flights, with back-to-back outbound reservations noted on dates like February 16-17, 2017 and March 7-8, 2017.

Epstein's travel included destinations such as the US Virgin Islands, St. Barts, Virgin Gorda (BVI), Morocco, and Canada, often using private aircraft with tail numbers including N212JE, N120JE, N415LM, N331JE, and N90JE.
The document notes 'vehicle' entries within the US Virgin Islands on multiple dates in 2016-2017, suggesting possible departures from US territory that require further verification.
The correspondence is marked as Law Enforcement Sensitive and includes a warning about unauthorized disclosure, indicating the sensitive nature of the travel investigation.
